GameEffectArguments.Name: Valid
GameEffectArguments.Description: Whether or not the terrain type is valid to move into.

GameEffectArguments.Name: NumCombatUnits
GameEffectArguments.Description: Number of combat units to spawn with the commander.

GameEffectArguments.Name: NumCities
GameEffectArguments.Description: Number of cities to spawn units near.

GameEffectArguments.Name: ForceSpawning
GameEffectArguments.Description: Spawn an army near the target city if a camp is not found.

GameEffectArguments.Name: TribeType
GameEffectArguments.Description: Only apply to specific tribe types if set.

GameEffectArguments.Name: CommanderType
GameEffectArguments.Description: Commander unit type

GameEffectArguments.Name: UnitTypes
GameEffectArguments.Description: Comma separate list of Unit types to add to the commander.

GameEffectArguments.Name: UnitTags
GameEffectArguments.Description: Comma separate list of Unit tags to add to the commander. The strongest unlocked or the weakest locked will be added.

GameEffectArguments.Name: BeliefYieldType
GameEffectArguments.Description: The string value of the belief yield type. This gets hasehd and then converted to the enum type.

GameEffectArguments.Name: BiomeType
GameEffectArguments.Description: The biome type to apply the BELIEF_YIELD_PER_BIOME yield amount

GameEffectArguments.Name: YieldType
GameEffectArguments.Description: The yield type to apply with the belief

GameEffectArguments.Name: TerrainType
GameEffectArguments.Description: The terrain type to apply the BELIEF_YIELD_PER_TERRAIN yield amount

GameEffectArguments.Name: ResourceType
GameEffectArguments.Description: The resource type that will act as a multiplier for this effect for each slotted instance of that resource.

GameEffectArguments.Name: BuildingType
GameEffectArguments.Description: The single building type that we want affected by this effect.

GameEffectArguments.Name: BuildingType
GameEffectArguments.Description: The building type to provide the purchase efficency for

GameEffectArguments.Name: BuildingTag
GameEffectArguments.Description: The building tag to provide the purchase efficency for

GameEffectArguments.Name: ConstructibleClass
GameEffectArguments.Description: The constructible class to provide the purchase efficency for

GameEffectArguments.Name: Percent
GameEffectArguments.Description: The percent purchase efficency to provide

GameEffectArguments.Name: UnhappinessEffect
GameEffectArguments.Description: Which unhappiness effect it ties to

GameEffectArguments.Name: Percent
GameEffectArguments.Description: The percent to increase

GameEffectArguments.Name: ConstructibleTag
GameEffectArguments.Description: The name a TAG that the constructible must have to be allowed to be purchased by a town.

GameEffectArguments.Name: UseAdvancedPillaging
GameEffectArguments.Description: Makes both Coastal Raiding and Pillaging 1 movement. Be careful if multiple game effects apply to something and are removeable; removing either of them will turn UseAdvancedPillage off.

GameEffectArguments.Name: UseFreePillaging
GameEffectArguments.Description: Makes both Coastal Raiding and Pillaging 0 movement

GameEffectArguments.Name: Range

GameEffectArguments.Description: How many of the listed gossips must have occurred for the requirement to be met.  Functions as an and/or manipulation

GameEffectArguments.Name: TurnWindow
GameEffectArguments.Description: A turn window in which the gossips must have occurred for the requirement to be met. The earliest gossip occurrence and the last must be within that turn window.  Default -1 means it isn't considered.

GameEffectArguments.Name: Distance
GameEffectArguments.Description: Some gossips have a tile location where it occurred.  This sets a max distance of where two gossips must have occurred in order to be met.  If there are more than two gossips in the requirement, this will not check and will always be not met.  Default -1 means it isn't considered.

GameEffectArguments.Name: AfterTurn
GameEffectArguments.Description: Sets a turn requirement.  Gossip occurrences before the turn set will not be considered. If used with AfterInit, the higher of the two will be used instead

GameEffectArguments.Name: AfterInit
GameEffectArguments.Description: Sets a turn requirement.  Gossip occurrences before the story was initialized will not be considered.  If used with AfterTurn, the higher of the two will be used instead

GameEffectArguments.Name: GossipTypes
GameEffectArguments.Description: Comma separated list of gossips to check against.  Each of these gossips becomes a new argument that can be used to provide additional parameters for the gossip.  This does expect two additional characters at the end to allow for duplicate gossip types with different parameters. eg If you want to check two GOSSIP_PILLAGE, enter GOSSIP_PILLAGE01 and GOSSIP_PILLAGE02.  The two additional characters must always be entered, regardless of duplicates or amount.

GameEffectArguments.Name: DynamicEntry
GameEffectArguments.Description: Dynamic Entry is not actually the argument type.  Each of the entries in GossipTypes can be used as their own argument.  The value is a comma separated list for parameters to check against, but each parameter comes in sets of 3: value specifier, parameter key, parameter value. Value specifier is Hash or Numeric, indicating how to treat the third of the triplet.  Parameter key is one of the parameters of the gossip, and value is the value to check against. Example - Hash,ConstructibleType,BUILDING_LIBRARY,Numeric,AdjacencyBonus,3

GameEffectArguments.Name: DuplicateCount
GameEffectArguments.Description: When using 1 gossip requirement, how many of the same gossip must be met. Error to use multiple entries.
